article: Early one morning, I witnessed romance at one the least-expected places in the world--a room in a rest home. At the time, my father _ a room with three other gentlemen. Before my daddy lived in the rest home, an elderly _ was sent there. Since there wasn't a double room _ , they were forced to separate the couple. The gentleman, Mr.West, was _ in the bed beside Daddy. His wife, Mrs.West, shared a room with several other ladies down the hall. When I went to see Daddy that morning, I _ Mr.West. Three employees were working with him. He hadn't eaten a bite of food _ he was sent several days earlier. I could _ by the expression on the nurses' faces that they were worried about him. Mr.West _ to open his mouth for any of them. "Go and get Mrs.West, " the nurse told her helper. "Maybe Mr.West will eat _ her. " In a few minutes a kind-looking lady was _ into the room. Her smile was contagious and Mr.West smiled _ . I felt as though I was intruding on a _ moment, but I couldn't take my eyes off the couple. The love between them was obvious, as Mrs.West patted Mr.West's hand. With a soft voice, Mrs.West tried to _ Mr.West to eat. To everyone's surprise, Mr.West opened his mouth and began to enjoy the _ and his wife's company. While the nurses fed him, he stared at his sweetheart with a smile on his face. Mrs.West began singing a song for him. The _ on his once solemn face became even brighter. Tears filled my eyes. The nurse then _ the curtain around the couple to give them some quality time alone. I discovered that _ doesn't only exist when we're young and in love. Romance _ a lifetime and grows stronger with age.
